stories.text:
I have a lot of experience working with STT and TTS models. I was reading this: https://www.theverge.com/22807858/tiktok-influencer-microsoft-excel-instagram-decoder-podcast and started wondering if creators would benefit from having a platform where they could create content centered around audio.

For the STT side: you would speak and have all your words transcribed in real-time, or post-processing is done to the audio to generate the whole transcript. This supports foreign languages besides English. For real-time transcription, you can even edit the text in-place (for situations where you want to correct text as you speak).

For the TTS side: you would supply the text and given an mp3 audio file in return that you could embed in a blog post or wherever your text exists. This also supports different languages, and the models can be trained to sound convincingly like you.

Not every person would use both, so I'm trying to gauge which would have more demand and why. Also how someone would use both if provided.

I have a lot of friends who write a lot with decent-sized audiences who said they'd be interested in this. But I was curious to see if anyone here would be interested as well.
